body: I guess the max length from https://github.com/Seldaek/monolog/blob/master/src/Monolog/Handler/HipChatHandler.php#L49 has been downgraded to 1000? cc @rdohms
That limitation was added afterwards by @leevigraham maybe he has some more insight? I have not used HipChat for 2 years now.
I'm not sure but I think that this feature should be in formater. What about case when I use HtmlFormatter and it make message longer than limit in HipChat?
Actually i think it needs to be in the adapter. Cause its the adapter's responsibility to know "how" to send the message. Which in this case means splitting a 3K char message in 3x1K messages.
Ok, good idea, but what about case when you cut html message inside html tag?
If anyone feels like doing a pull request to fix this that'd be great. I don't have any hipchat access so I can patch up the code but not check it works.

I have investigate this issue more and now I can say that limit is 10k. Why?
- we have use send room notification https://github.com/Seldaek/monolog/blob/master/src/Monolog/Handler/HipChatHandler.php#L168
- it has 10k limit https://www.hipchat.com/docs/apiv2/method/send_room_notification

I think we should split hipchat handler to v1 and v2 to ease code.

So it seems the limit is indeed 10000 and not 1000. @snapshotpl with which version of the API were you having issues? v1 or v2? Can you please contact hipchat if you're on v2, because it seems the endpoint we are using allows up to 10000chars and we limit to 9500 which should be safe.
v2. But I have written about this above
@Seldaek , additionally, I'd recommend adding unit-tests checking the exception situations, especially where length-limits are passed.

issue.title: [Question] Were listeners for 'illuminate.log' event removed as of late?
issue.body:
@taylorotwell , @GrahamCampbell :

Up until recently, my L-5.1 based app was successfully logging all and every exception that was thrown via unit-tests' exception scenarios. But after I upgraded to L-5.2, all those exceptions stopped being logged in external log-writers (i.e. Monolog handlers, such as Hipchat, Gitter etc). They still are being recorded in laravel.log file of course.

I debugged the case, and ended up in:
https://github.com/laravel/framework/blob/5.2/src/Illuminate/Events/Dispatcher.php#L220

where latest L-5.2 doesn't fetch any listeners for logging. My question is: were any loggers removed from Laravel as of late, as a result of which my custom log-handlers stopped logging any errors, but direct errors in app? Thanks.

body:
I think adding the third parameter to `fwrite()` function at:

https://github.com/Seldaek/monolog/blob/master/src/Monolog/Handler/SocketHandler.php#L227

equal to the max length of handler would solve the issue. Otherwise, you are using streams, not cUrl - how else will you be able to read the response of endpoint through stream resource?

Addendum: btw, this was working for me until recently, until coupla months ago. Did you change its workings recently?
